Package CIT2

Class CIT2_Boundary

java.lang.Object
type1.sets.T1MF_Prototype
CIT2.CIT2_Boundary
All Implemented Interfaces:
generic.MF_Interface, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable, type1.sets.T1MF_Interface
public class CIT2_Boundary
extends type1.sets.T1MF_Prototype
Class modelling the boundary of the FOU of a CIT2 FS.
Author:
Pasquale

  • Constructor Details

    • CIT2_Boundary

      public CIT2_Boundary​(java.lang.String name, CIT2_Boundary_Type type, type1.sets.T1MF_Interface first_embedded_set, type1.sets.T1MF_Interface last_embedded_set, CIT2_Generator generator_set, double left_shifting, double right_shifting)
      Constructor of the boundary
      Parameters:
      name - name of the boundary
      type - specifies if it is a lowerbound or an upperbound
      first_embedded_set - first embedded set in the FOU
      last_embedded_set - last embedded set in the FOU
      generator_set - the generator set used to generate the set
      left_shifting - maximum left shifting of the generator set to generate the FOU
      right_shifting - maximum right shifting of the generator set to generate the FOU

  • Method Details

    • getFS

      public double getFS​(double x)
      Computes the membership degree of the value x
      Parameters:
      x - A value in the UOD
      Returns:
      The double representing the membership degree of x

    • inIntervals

      public double inIntervals​(double x, java.util.Collection<Interval> intervals, CIT2_Boundary_Type type)
      Checks whether x belongs to one of the intervals. If it does, it returns its membership degree w.r.t the boundary function; it returns -1 otherwise
      Parameters:
      x - The value to check
      intervals - The intervals that x could belong to
      Returns:
      The membership degree of x w.r.t the boundary function, if it belongs to one of the intervals, -1 otherwise
